title: Static shiv & Rapid fire
body:
why are so many adc's taking that over phantom dancer + rapid/shiv

is it because of the quick recharge or is there something im missing? {{champion:51}}

replies.body:
Depends on the player, and what they see other players doing.

Shiv and RFC are great burst items for marksmen, especially when you can proc them both in the one attack, as the damage from RFC hits the target with the additional range, and Shiv does it's flashy spark damage and chains to others.

Phantom Dancer is a great defending offence item, and pairs magnificently with Death's Dance, reducing the damage you take and slowing the damage you take while giving you great offensive stats and life steal.

At the end of the day it comes down to two things, what is considered "meta" and what is one's personal preference.

If im losign ill grab a PD, if not ill grab a shiv, usually i realy like essence reaver for the cdr so sometimes dont get my last crit item until really late, if at all. it dpeends on how the game pans out, if they have a fed duelist? you want to be able to out duel them, a scary squishy? you'll want to burst them, a big tanky illaoi? well youll need all of the above and then some but late game you can do it!.

Klavinmour has a point.

I think the most simple answer is that many players arent overly strategic and just like straight up damage.
and the crit from the Shiv + Rapid combo is stronger than many abilities.
So that in itself is very appealing to many.

Also seeming ADC's are liable to die virtually instantly against many champs _(even with PD)_, 1-hitting the enemy before they 1-hit you often can be their most viable option. _"The best defence is a good offence etc."_

Personally though, I try to buy PD on Kalista _(pretty much the only ADC I can play with any degree of consistency)_ If I can.
